unalcol.io

Class ShortTermMemoryReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.io.Reader
      • unalcol.io.ShortTermMemoryReader
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable, java.lang.Readable

    public class ShortTermMemoryReader
extends java.io.Reader
    ShortTermMemoryReader

    A Reader that is able to maintain the latest read characters (according to its memory size).

    Source code is available.

        public int read(char[] cbuf,
                int off,
                int len)
         throws java.io.IOException
        Read characters into a portion of an array. This method will block until some input is available, an I/O error occurs, or the end of the stream is reached.
        Specified by:
        read in class java.io.Reader
        Parameters:
        cbuf - Destination buffer
        off - Offset at which to start storing characters
        len - Maximum number of characters to read
        Returns:

      • mark

        public void mark(int readAheadLimit)
        Marks the actual position as a mark for reseting the reader. The readAheadLimit is not used since it is determined dynamically. if the number of characters read, after calling the mark method, is greater than the size of the buffer then the mark is moved to such maximum number of characters. In this way at least the last n characters are always maintained by the reader.
        Overrides:
        mark in class java.io.Reader
        Parameters:
        readAheadLimit - Non used.

      • mark

        public void mark()
        Marks the actual position as a mark for reseting the reader

      • markSupported

        public boolean markSupported()
        Returns if the reader supports marks.
        Overrides:
        markSupported in class java.io.Reader
        Returns:
        true

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets the reader to the previous mark. Marks are dynamically adjusted in such a way that if the number of characters read, after calling the mark method, is greater than the size of the buffer then the mark is moved to such maximum number of characters. In this way at least the last n characters are always maintained by the reader.
        Overrides:
        reset in class java.io.Reader

      • skip

        public long skip(long n)
          throws java.io.IOException
        Skips n characters
        Overrides:
        skip in class java.io.Reader
        Parameters:
        n - Characters to be skipped
        Returns:
        Number of characters actually skipped
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - An exception if it was not possible to skip n characters.
